text: is there any hope? any help? it sure does not feel like it. it feels like there is no comfort or help anywhere for the pain and stress that have become constants in my life and driven me near the edge. lately i have been hit with a deluge of, to put it mildly, unpleasant life events, and i am left wondering how much more i can be expected to take. i try to find some comfort in cultivating a balanced life, but nothing seems to help. either that, or i stumble across something that makes everything worse. a nice evening with friends leads me right back to the crushing death spiral of depression as soon as i arrive back home to my empty flat. my work, which used to bring me pleasure or at least some measure of purpose, now feels like an insurmountable obstacle that i often can not even bring myself to face until the last minute in some case, after the last minute . my most recent romantic dalliance since my unwanted divorce, in which he offered me flowery promises of love and a life together, ended in heartbreak before it truly began. therapy is a temporary bandaid that prematurely gets ripped off between appointments, leaving me picking at the scabs until next ti ame. and inpatient treatment? so i can be subjected to some superficial group therapy meetings at best and doped up on antipsychotics at worst, all while being treated as a prisoner? forget it. so where can i realistically turn? it is a total cliche to say no one gets it, but it is true. no one who has not felt this way gets it. they can sympathize and try their best to understand the pain and the helplessness, but it is not something they can truly grasp. i am not particularly religious. in my mind as well as my heart i si amply can not believe in god or an afterlife since it just does not make sense to me. i dearly wish i could because the people i know who do so seem so happy, fulfi willed, and hopeful. i do, however, try to find some small comfort in the rituals and prayers i grew up with, and i can not stop myself from crying out to the universe or some god to deliver me from this hell in which i have found myself. not necessarily through death, but something has to give. coupled with the constant, overbearing weight of depression, this onslaught of pain has just become entirely too much to bear. they say real help comes from within, but what if there is nothing inside? i have nothing to give, to myself or to this world. so what can i even do? if it truly all comes down to me, i am doomed.

mind looked at the knife too and felt a faint stirring of alarm begin to flower. i do not know how to make it stop. i did not start it in the first place! i mean...can not you just ignore it? mind asked. he looked nervously at the knife. he had never known heart to do something like this. where was this coming from? heart turned the knife in his hand allowing the single light over the kitchen sink play across the blade. up, down the blade it went as heart stared at it. his right arm rotated ever so slightly, exposing the forearm for a moment. we have been ignoring it, you know that. you have been rationalizing them as down days, bad days, or days where i was just being moody, even when i tried to tell you it was more than that. we have even tried to search online to figure out how to fix whatever this is and how to make it stop. it is been going on for a long ti ame now, nearly a decade. i am just so tired, so sad, so... heart is voice trailed off as he seemed to be searching for words. depressed? text: i really want people to know that the contraceptive pi will can cause serious depression i am not trying to thiscourage anyone from taking the pi will as it can be an amazing form of contraception, as i thought it was for me and i raved about it for almost a year. but if you re taking it and you have symptoms of depression it really could be contributing. i started taking the pi will about a month before starting university so at first thought i was just homesick and unhappy and being out of my comfort zone. it was not until over a year later that i saw an article that really made me think. i can not describe the level of unhappiness i felt whilst on the pi will. i would dread getting out of bed, gained a lot of weight from comfort eating, would cry at random points for no apparent reason and after a while had serious thoughts about ki willing myself. what i could not understand is why because i felt like i had no reason to be unhappy. i had great friends and family, a loving boyfriend, i was doing well in my degree so why did i feel so low? it was only when i decided to stop the pi will that i noticed how much better i felt in myself. it scares me what the pi will did to me and what might have happened if i had stayed on it. so i just want people on the pi will to be aware of what it does and how much research there is out there linking depression to the pi will. i was in a place where i would try anything to be happy again and although i can not say i am smiling , i feel like the dark cloud hanging over my head has gone and i want to enjoy life as much as i can.

text: an i amportant personal experience with medication hi everyone, this is lengthy, but i feel like it is a very i amportant thing to read for those newly seeking help or who are having issues finding what works for them. i would like to start by saying this i have struggled with depression since i was very young, and never sought the help i desperately needed. i told myself i have got this , it would not work for me , and the usual excuses not to seek help. i went well over a decade without doing anything about it, went through the suicidal thoughts those sti will exist, please keep reading and i was told by many to get help, but i just never could get myself to actually do it. while i was loud and proud with my struggles, making jokes, etc. i was too embarrassed to tell a professional. i do not know why, but i just thought they would give me a hard ti ame or not take it seriously. i have never been taken very seriously by a doctor for a lot of my life, but after seeing my newest pcp consistently for about months and feeling a level of comfort and trust, i decided on a whi am to mention it. he diagnosed me with clinical depression, and i was placed on zoloft. my stomach hated me for that, and i spent months on the toilet consistently. my head felt a bit more clear, and i knew medication had side effects, so i figured it was normal and that was the balance god was i wrong . finally, i told hi am, so round , we went with lexapro. i felt awesome. i had energy again. i was talkative and engaging in social behavior again, but this is where it gets interesting. on top of all these pleasant feelings, i had a new set of problems. my anxiety ramped up tenfold. my suicidal thoughts became even more serious, and i began making random, i ampulsive, mid priced purchases dollars . did not really even think about that much, i just thought i am feeling good for once, to hell with it! . i opened new credit cards within a month period. so, why am i telling you that part? well, due to my severely increased anxiety and suicidal thoughts, a friend of mine noticed something she saw in her brother, and told me i need to go to a psychiatrist i ammediately, because she thinks there is something else wrong. she expressed why she felt this way, and how seriously this needs to be taken, and that i am scaring her and everyone else. so, i did. a couple weeks later, i go to my appointment, and i come out with a completely different diagnosis bipolar ii. i was placed on lamictal, and within a week, the fog was lifted. i felt such relief. i began therapy, and i am here now, a couple months later, and i am fixing the damage done while on i amproper medication. the moral of the story here is, if you have problems and your first step that you feel comfortable with is to tell your pri amary care doctor, that is absolutely fine but monitor yourself. see what gets better, and if other things get worse, and make note of them. otherwise, you may find yourself dollars k in debt and damaging everything and every relationship you have, without ever realizing what you re doing. i empathize with all of you here, i know what depression does to you. i suffered for so long, and i am finally on a road to recovery. there is no shame in speaking to a professional about what is happening, and i can not express this enough and do not take this the wrong way if you think help would not work for you try it anyway. you have nothing to lose, and you may find that you re not as special as you think you are. it works for a lot more people than it does not work for. you re more likely to be the statistic of those it does work for. keep at it. please. and if you re curious about my account age no post history my main account has a bit too much pii and i figured this may be the ti ame to start using this one. if you read this far, thank you.
label: moderate

text: m sharing my story. freedom from severe depression! hello everybody. i just wanted to share my personal experience with major depression in the hopes that i may provide some inspiration, motivation to those that are struggling! this wi will be long, i would prefer not to summarize things! for nearly two decades, i had major depressive thisorder i felt completely overwhelmed by my depression. it ate up all my mental and physical energy, like a vampire within my own mind that i felt i could not get rid of. this affected my self worth, lowered my self i amage, and made me feel ashamed to interact with other people, because i was ashamed of myself, and i did not want anybody to see that part of me. therefore, i spent a lot of ti ame isolating myself from others and have had very few close friends that i felt i could be truly honest with. i saw numerous counselors, psychiatrists, life coaches, psychoanalysts, you name it. i tried different medications, and i even had neurofeedback sessions spread out across months. i was determined to become free, to live a better life. during those nearly two decades, i would try a new therapist, or new medication, or new workout routine, or new diet and in the beginning, it wouldn t work out the way i expected. often, i would find that most things just covered up the depression, but did not help permanently thissolve it. this led to a seemingly never ending cycle of building the courage to not lose hope, try something new to treat the depression, become thiscouraged or thisi willusioned that it was not working, then fall back into feeling victi amized by my depression and retreating into social isolation, using drugs, masturbation, unhealthy food and other thistractions as a placeholder for my sadness. as i continued trying new treatments for the depression, even if it did not work out the way i anticipated, with each new go, i was unconsciously feeding energy to a very thistant part of myself a self that had the wi will to be more, to feel and share joy with others. it was the pure, innocent and loving part of myself that had been buried by the momentum of nearly two decades of negative beliefs, thoughts and physical acts. ulti amately, in choosing to keep going and not give up, i was also choosing to acknowledge and listen to this part of my self. as a result, i was gradually chipping away at the depression making it more and more manageable, and less pervasive in my mind. although again, i was not conscious of this at the ti ame. i just want to let anyone reading this know that i genuinely felt for the longest ti ame that i was going to be depressed forever. i could not see a way out and thought of ki willing myself nearly every day of my life. and yet as i am typing this, i am experiencing more mental freedom then i could have ever i amagined. i would not be experiencing this if i had given up. i chose to keep going, even though i was afraid that i would fail again and become even more thiscouraged. eventually, i found the right therapist, the right medication, i thiscovered neurofeedback, and things began to click for me. it was not an instant process, again it was gradual. i can see now that my depression was just like a computer program that was projecting the same negative thoughts, beliefs into my mind. i realized that any specific belief or thought that repeats in my mind is not me the true being that i am is a creative being. i also realized that how i feel at any given ti ame is directly correlated with whether or not i have allowed these negative programs into my mind. but i can separate myself from these thoughts i can detach myself from these thoughts, i do not have to let these thoughts in. i can let them die, until the depression machine loses its stored energy, and thus loses its power over my mind and how i feel. once i started becoming more and more conscious of this i could detect the negative thoughts in my mind as they appear, and rather than being passive and allowing them in, or choosing to identify myself with these thoughts, i could go into a neutral state and instead choose to reject them. then, i could more easily tap into my positive, loving, opti amistic self. it is a lot like changing the channel to better one on a tv, except in my mind. although i am sti will struggling from ti ame to ti ame, the depression is way less prominent, and i have so much more hope and faith that things wi will get better. and if i can do it considering how hopeless i used to think things were, feeling like i was in a black hole of despair with no escape, and how many mistakes i have made that fed the depression then i truly believe that everybody has the capacity to do it. it is a process, of course... but the journey of a hundred miles begins with the first step!

text: a reminder that no matter how awful things seem, there wi will always be something that makes you happy i have been feeling really hopeless recently, and i did not even have enough energy to want to die. i just sat where i was and repeated i can not do this for minutes straight. when i opened my eyes, i saw a shirt on my floor that my dad gave me last year, that he wore for almost decades and consequently was very comfortable to have on. seeing his shirt brought the thought that, no matter how bad i get, and no matter what mood my dad is in, he is sti will going to love me. it did not i ammediately cure my depression and make me start dancing around my house, but it definitely helped to counter that utterly hopeless feeling. i wore that shirt when i went to sleep that night, and for the first ti ame in a while, i was able to keep it together while i fell asleep. i know a lot of you have probably felt si amilar to me before, and i know how stupid it feels to have someone tell you to just think positive! when all you want to do is quietly fade away into nothing, but please, next ti ame you feel like you have hit rock bottom, or even when you have not and you just are not feeling too good, find one thing, any one thing, no matter how small or seemingly meaningless it is, that makes you happy. i am not asking you to write a page, bullet noted thissertation on the meaning of happiness and how to strive for it, i am just asking you to find one small thing that makes you laugh, smile, blow air out your nose, or even just feel slightly less depressed. if you can not do it for yourself, do it for me. all the love, ultra

text: i am making life better i have been meaning to post this for a while. i am currently feeling like shit, so i thought i would come here to complain about my problems, but i decided not to. i hate complaining someti ames, as much as i do. and this is not a criticism, but this subreddit is too negative, so i thought i should sprinkle a little hope and positivity. some background i was officially diagnosed with depression at years old, along with autism and anxiety. i consider myself a survivor of emotional and verbal abuse though someti ames i doubt myself if it was actually abuse, but that is what abused people do . i have struggled to make friends my entire life. it is pretty safe to say i was not popular, which sucked because of my terribly low self esteem. i used to have suicidal thoughts at different points in my life, until recently. i had considered suicide multiple ti ames in my life, although i never made any attempts. also until recently, i had a nasty habit of aggressive self deprecation. i am recently single from a relationship that i thought was the one , but upon having been dumped, i realised that i was mistreated, so i am kinda grappling with heartbreak and coming to terms with the feelings that come with having, for a second ti ame, allowed myself to be treated poorly in a relationship. i think it is pretty safe to say, starting in my, probably early teen years, i have not been a happy person, not for long at least. i constantly suffer from a anhedonia, which is honestly torturous because it stops me from doing what i really enjoy doing. having kind of brushed over my life history with shitty feelings, now to the positivity. i am exercising every night. it is not much, but it is something. i have taken up yoga i hate it, it sucks, it is painful, but apparently it helps with depression and anxiety, so i figured it is worth a go. point is, i have set goals and i am sticking to them. i started a tafe course australian thing weeks ago, and i love it i did two years of university and they were some of the worst years of my life. tafe is so much better for me. it is only two days a week, and i wish those days wouldn t end. i cleaned my bedroom a few weeks ago, and i have kept it clean. for the first ti ame in three years, i am making friends. i would love to build up the confidence to ask them out for a casual drink, or anything outside of tafe, but baby steps. could things be better? absolutely. as i am writing this, i am feeling shitty and lonely, and i just want someone to talk to. i am sti will struggling with anhedonia, and i want to enjoy myself again. but things are getting better. i finally have stuff to look forward to again. i was, and sti will am, sick of people saying it gets better , so i decided to make things better. i can not make everything better, i wish i could, but i am i amproving what i can control. i know a lot of people who read this wi will be like i wish this would happen for me , or i wish i could make friends , or i can not do this, or that , etc. and i am sorry. i wish this could be inspirational to someone, but i acknowledge the harsh, shitty reality of depression that things like that just do not happen for some of us. but maybe, maybe the fact that i am getting better wi will give someone, at least one person here hope that they too wi will get better. i can not promise things wi will get better for anyone, i especially can not promise that to myself, but i sincerely hope, as someone who has battled with depression for over half their life, and wi will continue to do so for a long ti ame to come, i desperately hope things do get better for all of you.

text: feeling happy and enjoying life for once i was twelve when i noticed something in me change. the way i thought of the world changed. instead of me living on earth, i felt like i was constantly fighting to find my purpose for being on this planet. i felt insignifican not compared to everything. i felt like that annoying side character no likes or asked for. i have felt this way for most of my life. i felt hollow and alone stuck under a cloud of darkness. everything i did or touched was tainted by my negative presence. i pushed away everyone, kept them all at arms thistance. because i felt this constant pressure following me everywhere. i screamed for help. but i felt like no one understood, no one could hear, no one cared. except one. i know her more than i could ever payback. she saw my pain. she felt my pain. she helped me the best she could and for that, i appreciate her more than most people in my life. one day when i was sixteen, i felt my chest tighten. i felt like someone turned off the oxygen switch. i felt the room spin and close in on itself. it was my first anxiety attack. shortly after that, i attended therapy for the first ti ame. i enjoyed it, but my family thought it was a waste soo. i stopped. throughout my life, i have been up and very down. there was a point where i thought about plunging a kitchen knife into myself and just letting myself bleed there on the cold floor. and then there were moments when my brother and i were driving in the car blasting music. it was bliss. but as always the negative tends to overtake the positive. i struggled a lot. with everything. i failed classes and flunked out of nursing school. that was my lowest low. i felt like i failed everyone and like i did not deserve to live or to be cared for. i dedicated myself to work. i found comfort in care for others. i fell in love with nursing again. i finally now have a medication combo that works for me. i found something to dedicate myself to. i have found a purpose, a reason to live, a reason to exist. i am here to say the darkness never truly goes away. i know how cliche and how some of you have heard that ti ame and ti ame again. but, slowly it gets more manageable. be patient. i am right now. and i can say with confidence i do not have my shit together. but i have realized something no one else does either. it is okay, to not be okay. take a deep breath. play devil is advocate, find reasons to live and keep saying them out loud. eventually, you would not have to convince yourself.

text: therapeutic venting depression is an awful way to spend a life and in some unfortunate cases can cause a life to be cut short. the scariest part about depression is that it can sneak up on anyone and affect the people who seem the least likely. i have been unlucky enough to experience the aftermath of someone taking the ulti amate path to ending their depression, twice. both ti ames is came seemingly out of nowhere, completely blindsiding me at the ti ame but looking back, i should have seen the signs and feel like i should have acted to prevent their decisions. this alone is a futile thought though, as when someone does not want to be helped it is always going to be hard to reach them. both of them reassured me that they were doing well and i took them at their word, some may call it naivety, but i want to be able to trust people. knowing what i know now of course, i would have acted, but hindsight wi will always be . in the grand scheme of things, how do i know that my words would have even altered their chosen path. i do not believe in fate, but someti ames i do believe that a person who is feeling trapped in their mind wi will find a way to end their suffering one way or another. this is after all, just the ramblings of someone who is struggling with their own mind and is trying to type this out to take his mind off of all of the turmoil inside. for some reason i have latched onto a poor girl and have laser focused my self worth behind what she thinks of me, more than likely driving her away. it is tough when you do not feel like you re in control of your emotions, seemingly spirally out of control without a moments notice. feeling like you re all okay when you are surrounded by people who care for you, but behind closed doors you sti will struggle to control yourself. there is strange waves of exhaustion that hit where you feel like you could crash but as soon as you try and crash your mind begins swirling in thoughts and things that cause anxiety and stress. i was worried about things out of my control and i broke my old adage control the controllables , my coach had built this adage into my everyday life as i would someti ames lose control of my emotions when i played. he could see that i would hide behind a false bravado and would attempt to mask many of my insecurities with humour, constantly self deprecating. he always made sure that i would repeat and focus on the adage and would hold myself accountable to the actions and emotions that i could control. i can not control what other people think of me, but i need to control my own perception of myself. this girl has been more than understanding and has given me plenty of leeway of how insecure i am and has done her best to put my mind at ease, but i have always assumed the worst intentions of people when i get in these sort of funks and i think i have finally pushed her away enough. the only reason that i am even writing this is because i was not able to sleep and hoped this would thistract me from the fact that i am awake at am. i am so scared that people wi will think so much less of me because i have these struggles, usually i am able to contain these on my own and put my brave face on when i feel it coming. but this ti ame it was too much, it built up too quickly and i was unprepared for the emotions that would flood through me. it is what made things so hard to control, i opened up to people that normally i would want to hide it from, i hate being perceived as weak, but i needed help. i had never really thought of suicide in a true way, but i have caught myself casually wishing that something on the outside would end it, maybe another car would take me out, a hit to the head, some sort of freak accident to spare my family the shame of me. those thoughts scared me and caused me to open up to a couple people, i probably should have kept my mouth shut as it did not truly feel like it helped anything, it may have even exacerbated things because some of the actions seemed to go in the complete opposite direction of where i thought they would go. then again, for all i know these negative thoughts have all just poisoned and pervaded into every other thought causing me to think the worst about peoples actions. and therein lies the problem of depression.. you begin to second guess your own thoughts because you know that you are being negative, but then you start to rationalise why that thought should be negative. it is the never ending loop that has been playing in my mind. then you start to second guess every interaction you have with people, wondering if they were being genuine or whether they are just trying to placate you because they know you re damaged goods. which just feeds into the self loathing because you start to truly believe that you re a burden on people and they are just looking forward to the moments away from you. if i send a message i wonder how it is perceived, if they do not respond i automatically assume that it is an eye roll type situation even if it is an innocent mistake of just forgetting to respond. this morphs into the worry that if you then message again you re being pushy and can not take a hint, so you end up checking up constantly and worrying that you have fucked everything up. it is a nasty cycle that i have managed to perfect quite. i have always had the worry in my mind that i have some sort of social awkwardness or inability to truly socialise, always feel like i am putting on a facade to make people like me. i think the whole reason that i have latched onto this girl is because i actually feel like i can be me around her and she has not run for the hi wills as of yet, she can be quite selfish but i believe the selfishness is more to do with a lack of forethought than malice. but then i sound positive and i almost have to remind myself that she has preferred to spend her nights sleeping with another guy and even though they both have been upfront about it not being sexual, i can not help but have those negative thoughts intrude and assume the worst. this feeds into why i believe that i have driven her away, surely she is sick of a neurotic, depressed individual pining after her and causing her undue thiscomfort with his brokenness. especially after telling hi am that she is not into feelings and relationships and he carrying on almost as if he has some sort of say in what she gets to do. unfortunately the way that this depression managed to invade my mind so stealthily was because of an anniversary. katrina took her life on the rd of february, but because of how our interactions had been going i assumed she had just gotten busy, so i got busy myself and managed to reach the pinnacle thus far of my career. so it was only on the th of february where i started to really worry that something was wrong, i looked her up and was ashamed to find out that she had passed away and i had not even realised. here i was celebrating myself and my achievements over text to her and her poor family were the ones who were probably receiving those messages in their grief. i was fortunately in a room to myself by this point and broke down, i felt so worthless that i had not been able to get her to see how special that she was to me and everyone else around her. she felt lost and i could not help her enough to find herself. the thing that hurt the most was seeing the date of her death and realising that i had been speaking to her the day before she made that fateful decision and knowing that she did not feel comfortable with me enough to share and tell me how much she was struggling. i guess that is one the reasons that i finally reached out to my parents on a particularly bad night exhaustion and hunger exacerbating the swirling thoughts in my head causing me to finally crack. katrina is anniversary also made me reflect on the way that i found out about luke, spoken to hi am in person less than a month before and he seemed so happy and relaxed. we spoke about the future and talked about how nice it wi will be for hi am to finally be able to relax without baseball and the worries of staying healthy. i had kept in contact with hi am while i was back in australia and although he someti ames seemed a little bit off, he always reassured me that he was doing well, made headway on seeing his children and i got to see updated pictures of them. i went away on a softball clinic in a remote area and was having a really good ti ame and had even messaged hi am about how it was such easy money to make because i was enjoying it. then suddenly i have one of our mutual friends asking if i would heard about luke, almost instantly i felt a knot in my stomach and knew that he had taken his own life. my worst fears were unfortunately realised as i started trying to prove things wrong, i felt numb, my vision tunnelled and i felt a bit lost. the only saving grace for that period was how i was able to continue to do the clinics and the kids were able to keep my mind away from all the negative emotions. but i had not dealt with them and that is where i went wrong, i pushed them to the side and just assumed that i would be able to talk about it down the track. but i never did, i did not want to, because it again felt like i should have had some part in preventing it and because i did not felt like i played a role in it. anger at luke also crept into my mind as he knew how hurt i was about katrina as he was one of the people that i spoke to about her, he was one of my closest friends and he sti will took his own life. some people say that it was probably to spare my feelings, which i do understand, but it does not soften the blow. obviously he could not go on anymore, but i would have rather he flew to australia and tried a fresh start here. i guess that this actually been a bit therapeutic to me, i do not even know why thought i would write this out, i have not written this for any other reason than that i wanted to pass the ti ame before i have to get up and try to go about my day productively. i was going to go for a run but i figured that was not the brightest of ideas considering that i had not eaten anything today and i am supposed to play a game in the afternoon. playing on hours sleep is certainly going to be an experience, hopefully i do not have any stupid breakdowns on the drive there. but i should not, i wi will just jam out to some music and try and push the bullshit to the bottom as i usually do. i am so sick of this, i just want to be normal. i have now involved too many people and i feel shit as is anyway, so that is fun. so many stupid as fuck decisions, but hey, that is just what i do. i wonder if i wi will read back on this and laugh about how dumb this all seems.. i hope so. maybe i can read this next year when i decide to go insane again and i can try and ground myself before i do all this dumb shit again. fuck me, you d think that i would have some sort of forethought and would stop being a drag to be around, no wonder you pushed people away and caused such an unnecessary amount of stress to people that do not deserve that. you have not even called your best friend back and let hi am ring out twice, you re lucky to have such an incredible friend and you take hi am for granted just because you re feeling weak. you re quite literally doing exactly what luke and katrina did to you to hi am, you can not get mad about things if you do not learn from their previous mistakes. have some feel and talk to hi am, maybe you can give hi am a call tomorrow on the drive there. wi will that reignite the turmoil or wi will that help quash it before you get out there? i guess you wi will have to find out. the trouble is that you re supposed to try and socialise with people when you re like this to thistract yourself, but it is hard when feel like you force people to be around you. i may even drop in and visit my friend tomorrow after the game, see if he wants to do dinner. i am sure he would not be too upset by it, but i do not want to feel like i am i amposing and i would feel shit if she was there because then it would just seem weird and creepy, not letting her enjoy her ti ame with hi am. he is certainly less of a wet blanket than you are currently.. the funny thing about this little essay that i have typed is that i was originally planning to try and create an actual story with random characters and see if i could use this as a creative outlet, but instead i have just typed out some of the negative thoughts and things i have done. positively, it has caused me to get a little bit tired, although it is now nearing am, so it is not like if i sleep i wi will getting a worthwhile sleep anyway, so that is fun.. this has also reminded me of my college days, getting up early or staying up late and pounding out an essay the best i can and somehow sti will hoping for a good mark even though it is more than likely a complete mess. i do not even want to think about what a mess this whole thing is, guarantee that it is full of plenty of errors and skipped words where my fingers can not keep up with the brain and i get ahead of myself. if someone other than me ever reads this, i pity you and apologise in advance!

text: cleaning the depression mess in your home when depressed and overwhelmed tip for anyone looking i just recent learned this the hard way and was able to clean out about years worth of depression mess from my home. get the clear garbage bags the ones often used for collecting leaves and whatever area you are starting in if it is garbage it goes in a regular black bag and if you are keeping it it goes in the clear bag. it makes it way easier to get through the clutter and mess when you are starting out and you do not have a spot to put the keep items. often that is what i found to be so overwhelming i was just moving things from one spot to another and never felt like i was getting anywhere. then once your place is emptied of the garbage and your floor is finally visible and you can vacuum sweep wash it you can put the clear bags in the rooms they should be in and then empty them one bag at a ti ame.

text: i just want to be happy. my depression has been so much worse since the death of my best friend. he was taken from me last sunday, and every night i find myself crying in bed over what has happened. before this i was finally starting to learn how to be happy again. i was slowly coming to terms with the violent death of my mother, becoming more open with my friends, and learning to not hate myself as much. now though i just feel like a lot of my progress has been ripped from me, and i guess people can argue that i let my progress be stunted but i can not help how i feel about this entire mess. not only have i started having suicidal thoughts again, but i have found myself just really down, having zero energy, constantly crying, and just not wanting to be around people. i feel really closed off, and i do not know what to do because the coping mechanisms that were working are not working as much. mostly because i can not comprehend why the world has to shoot me when i finally heal from the last bullet it shot into me. i do not understand why i can not just be happy for once, and why something terrible has to happen after only a few months of happiness. i know people argue that happiness wi will never be permanent, and i am fully aware of that. if you do not feel sadness then are you even truly living your life? but all my life i have been so depressed, angry with myself, and have hated myself. i finally start to not feel these things as much, and then something like this happens. i never expected not to feel sadness, but i guess i did not expect something i care about and love with all my heart dying so soon after my mom did. the world could have done anything to make me feel bad. not give me the internship i was gunning for, cause a rift between me and a friend, car accident... truly anything, and i would have been able to cope my way out of it, but another death? it is so hard to cope with that because death is something that makes something permanently gone. you can never get that thing back. you can never have memories with them again. death is so very permanent. a fight with a friend can be resolved, or you can move on knowing you re both making the best of life and that you have spoken your peace. a new internship can come along, one that might be even better then the one you were gunning for. you can heal from a car accident, and even if you do not fully heal you can at least learn to live a semi happy life with the damage. death though? there is no options there. you can never bring that thing back. you can never resolve that issue. you can never fully move on from it. it is always there in the back of your mind, watching you, reminding you that it can take something from you at any point and that everything you care about wi will one day be owned about it. you see, i have lost pets to death and coped okay for the most part, mostly because almost all my pets have died from old age. they lived a full, happy life. i never really comprehended death until i lost someone who was a major part of my life, and now i suppose you can argue i am over sensitive to it now. i am worried for death taking every person at some point. i i amagine how i would feel if certain people die, and i make myself depressed i amagining how lonely life would be without them. most of the people in my life are going as well with plenty of life to live, but that matters little because now i understand that there is a chance for anyone dying at any point. every ti ame someone drives a car, every ti ame some walks across the street, every ti ame someone gets sick, hell, really any ti ame someone wakes up in the morning is a chance of them dying. so every night i cry. i mostly cry over those i have lost, especially my sweet baby boy who passed away on sunday, but i also cry at the prospect of who wi will die next. who wi will be taken from me next? when wi will they be taken? wi will it be in a few years? in a few months? tomorrow? someti ames i feel bad because nobody wants to hang around someone who is constantly scared of the world and constantly down. so someti ames i wish it would just be me who dies next, so nobody has to put up with me anymore, and so everyone i love can live a stress free life. people deserve so much better then what i give them, and i am nothing more then a burden in their life. so if i could take their spot in the list i would, because they deserve to live more then i do. i have always said i would die for someone, even most of my ani amals, and people always chuckle like i am joking but honestly i am not. i realize how depressed death makes someone, so if i can prevent others from feeling that pain i would gladly offer up my insignifican not life that people would not grieve over as much. i just wish i could be happy. for once in my life.

text: , with years of night. i walk at night. not to one place or another, just around. i used to cli amb the fence to the cemetery near my house, but i am not a kid anymore and it would look too weird to anyone that spotted me. i used to though, and it was nice in there. now i walk down to a channel that runs through my college town. it is nice but homeless people call out in the dark, lost in their own issues and drug altered states of mind. it is not dangerous. the homeless are almost always afraid, even the ones that act aggressive when you surprise them. most of them know me now, not my name but because they have seen me there, down by the water, lumbering along like a tall ghost. one of them slowly raises his hand when he sees me. i raise my hand in return a slow greeting and goodbye in a single, wordless gesture. i have it good. there is no reason for these long hushed walks. i am comfortable in life. my girl is a saint, my parents are loving. nothing damaging, beyond what life takes from all of us, has happened to me. i used to talk about the night walk, the depression, but i eventually found that no one had a cure, no one could comfort the human condition. so i stopped letting others know. my parents talk about my depression in the past tense, which i prefer. allowing them to think it was just a short term issue makes me feel good, as if i am preforming a service, just letting them go on without worry. i owe them at least that much. i have tried drug, legal and i willegal, in an attempt to sooth my mind, or shift it to a lighter setting, but not change that core aspect of me. the philosophy held out against a hazmat truck load of alcohol, psychedelics, uppers, pi wills, and balls to the wall adrenaline doses that would split a lions heart in two. it did not change anything, except making stand up comedy better. if you have not tried drugs, just know they wi will not fix anything. i never got addicted to any of it, only gained the knowledge that drugs are a temporary alteration and even hallucinating that your brain is in control of the flight patterns of migratory birds gets to be a calm sort of normal after a while. skip it. i wi will be out there tomorrow night. wool coat and scally cap, bushy beard and worries on my mind. if you see me, do not raise your hand, no hello goodbye. if there are answers, i do not have them.
label: moderate

text: i tried to ki will myself on monday night. for the first ti ame ever, i did not chicken out or try to seek help. it did not work. not sure where to go from here. i have made a bunch of suicide attempts over the past years, but usually i chicken out by telling someone and or going to a hospital. this was the first attempt i have made in years, and i did not stop myself. i looked up the lethal dose for the pi wills then took twice that. i felt so happy, so relieved. finally, my life would be over. but instead, i spent that entire night in an excruciating amount of pain, curled up by the toilet, puking my guts out until all i had left to vomit was my stomach bile. in the morning, i finally stopped throwing that up too. i called in sick to work and told them i had the flu. my boss was not thri willed with me because i was supposed to be in at am and did not email her until pm. but she said she was mainly worried, because it was so unlike me. three of my coworkers texted me to see if i was okay. i was not expecting that, i did not realize they actually cared. i had a call with my therapist yesterday, and i did not tell hi am. i told hi am that my mental health has tanked, and that i was sick in bed with the flu. and without knowing what i would already done, he said he was worried about my mental state and asked if i had suicidal thoughts. i told hi am i did, but that i had not settled on a good method for suicide yet, so he had nothing to worry about. that is true, i guess. i sti will do not have a good method. i sti will do not want to live. but i also can not even think about attempting again right now. as i waited for the pi wills to take effect, i knew that i would have stomach problems so i chewed on candied ginger and drank chamomile tea. now i can not smell either without getting nauseous. for others who have gone through with an unsuccessful suicide attempt, what did you do next? i do not necessarily mean in terms of executing a plan, i just mean like in life. do you just go back to work once the physical side effects have worn off and pretend like everything is fine? did you do something drastic like buy a plane ticket and pack up your shit? or do you quit your job and turn into even more of a hermit? before you suggest it, i am not going to tell anyone in real life what i have done. i can not put my friends and family through this shit again, not unless it is finally over.

text: i think broken people are wiser. first off, let me just say i am not glorifying depression in any way. it is a serious mental i willness that so many people face. i wouldn t wish this on my worst enemy as it is one of the toughest battles i have ever had to face in my life. that being said, it just occurred to me as i was walking in the rain, coffee in hand and passing people with their groups of friends i know, sounds so tumblr . they were laughing about something and i just could not get how someone could always be happy. this group that i saw was always happy like always we live on the same floor . that was when i remembered the term ignorance is bliss, and the meaning that has on our life. and for the record i am not saying that happy people live in delusional little worlds and are ignorant in a dumb or arrogant sense. they are not. everyone has been through hardships and insecurities. but i think the wiser are the people who have gone through stuff in their life and have the ability are doomed to feel the highest sense of emotion in the worst possible way. they are able to think deeper and see bigger pictures. and that means that majority of the wiser are fi willed with broken people. i do not think i am smart or a genius in any way seriously my grades definitely back me up there , but i pride myself on my memory and my observance. i just kept thinking would i trade all of this thinking for a genuine smile? would i swap depression for ignorance? my answer is yes. i would rather be blissful and happy than suffer like this. sorry if this makes no sense, i am tired and downing coffee despite it only being in the evening. but it is raining and gloomy and my mind is wandering. now that i read this it honestly does not make much sense to me. i guess it is a way of venting or even making myself feel the slightest bit better. i am a lonely, broken spirit in the least beautiful way.

makes the problems worse. it sounds as if i would get better from depression if i suffered in silence. that is definitely not the case. i totally get not wanting to be around me because i only have negative things to say, or not wanting to talk about certain topics. but that is upon you, you should just say i do not like listening to you complain , not making it a personal fault of mine. i feel momentarily better for getting things off my chest and i have a friend or two who i can count on for that. not speaking or not having someone to talk to makes me feel more lonely. he is buddhist, his rationale went like this complaining is bad on the long term. not complaining gives your better relief on the long term because complaining is fighting against the world while you should be making peace with it. when you do make peace, you can apply the energy you spend on fighting on looking for solutions. when you make peace with it, you do not have to complain about it, which makes a virtuous cycle. that rings true to some extent, although the rest of what he told me just sounds very thismissive of my problems. i was saying how this buddhist monk said that, when we re tired, we text: on being okay with not being okay and going through it alone i think this is an i amportant step to take when trying to heal from depression. accepting your reality and your emotions and not needing to hold on to every little thing that might make your day the tiniest bit more bearable or positive. it is okay if your friend is too busy to talk, it is okay if you run out of your drug of choice. it is okay that the only di am flicker of light in the darkness, the only thing that made you crack a smile, is not there anymore. do not feel bad for going through it alone. this is someti ames necessary. all i hear all over social media is that you re not alone, you re loved, you re wanted. what if this is not the case? do not feel sorry for yourself if this is not the case. you need to be okay with not being okay by yourself. because every day you go through it alone, you re giving yourself the chance to be your own support system. forgive yourself. as long as you re alive, you objectively have a chance to heal. take that chance. sure, reach out for help but also, attempt to help yourself when others can not be there. you do not know if you can do it alone. you might not be able to. but you re the only one that has full responsibility over that. everyone is living their own life, worrying pri amarily about themselves and the ones that do not, are sacrificing themselves to do that. which is okay for parents but not always otherwise and should not be encouraged. you need a degree of selfishness to maintain your mental health. i hope this does not come across as encouraging people not to get help. i just have to point out that not everyone has the means to reach out to people and to be loved by others. no one should derive their self worth from that. you have to love yourself and that takes a shit load of suffering to do correctly. but in the end, it is always worth it. because the freedom you feel from truly loving yourself and not needing someone to love you or give you attention, is incomparable to anything else. it is never too late to achieve that.

text: some of my perspectives on depression i have spent a decent amount of ti ame on here reading posts and also a good amount of my life depressed. i wanted to share some of my observations on depression that i do not hear about too often. a vicious cycles of depression many of us know depression as a cycle that feeds on itself as sustenance. if we re depressed because we re lonely that depression also makes it more likely that we avoid social interaction making us more lonely making us more depressed and so forth compounding onto itself. you may find this to be very devastating but i believe knowing depression as a cycle can be useful if the psyche is ready to step out of the cycle. cycles are like false traps, to explain this idea i want you too understand cycles in other things in life. all life is cyclical and all cycles sustain themselves by repeating the cycle. one example is the water cycle where water evaporates by heat into the atmosphere until it cools and collects until to fall back down as rain. i suggest you think about other cycles because this may help your understanding of cycles. the interesting thing about cycles is that they can not sustain themselves in and of themselves. all cycles have some kind of mysterious force or energy that kicks starts and then sustains them. in the case of the water cycle it is the heat generated by the sun. so there is an interesting paradox here that applies to the cycle of depression. even though the cycle seems perpetual like a never ending dark night or you feel trapped in the cycle of depression that seems endless there does not exist any cycle in life or of life that is able to sustain itself in and of itself. there is always something mysterious something beyond fueling it. if this source energy could be located and eli aminated it would also end the cycle. tl dr cycles are not internally sustainable such as the cycle of depression. if one could be successful in determining the external energy fueling the cycle the cycle can thiscontinue. if a did not work then continue to b b all sources to cycles are ulti amately mysterious if a did not work for you you have got other problems. someti ames we can locate the source and transcend the cycle, someti ames not. if you are reading this then you tried to locate the source of your depression. what happens is that you may find a potential source but upon further inspection of that source it itself revealed itself as another cycle a bigger cycle or a more complex cycle and now you nonetheless hopelessly find yourself back where you started or in an even bigger mess of cycles. to i willustrate this picture we can talk about the water cycle. we know the water cycle is powered by the heat of the sun. the heat of the sun is due to none other than the nuclear fusion cycle. if we were to inspect more closely the nuclear fusion cycle we would also see that this cycle is also created by other cycles. so we see here that all sources to cycles are cycles so cycles are cycling themselves. this is contradicting a is not it? i did say this was paradoxical. in this state advice or knowledge is not going to help you anymore because you re actually trapped in the cycle of knowledge, if you made this your profession you d be called an epistemological philosopher. realize the reality of this code of language is knowledge it is the very poison that is feeding your cycle of knowledge you are trapped in. period. what do you do? idk god help you. depression as a deeply personal thing many of us know depression text: this is what helped me overcome my depression. this wi will help you too being a sufferer of depression, and finally overcoming it after years of unbearable torture, it is my moral obligation to let others know what helped me overcome my depression . first let me briefly tell you what i was going through so anyone reading this can relate and know that i too had faced the same problems that you are facing now. and i did overcome all of this. i did get better. and you can too i suffered from depression for years. it was an unbearable situation where my mind would be bombarded with sad depressing thoughts throughout the day. i could aomehow make it through the day and finally sleep off, only to wake up to the same horror the next day. there were days when i just went to sleep so as to get relief from my monster mind. i tried several options to get myself better. i quit smoking, quit alcohol, meditated daily. but nothing was working for me. and then finally, when nothing else worked, after years of suffering, i opted to go consult a doctor for my condition. i was prescribed medications. i took them. and i got better. sounds si ample right? well that is the catch. people suffer for months and years, but hesitate to go see a medical professional. while you can and should try all sorts of alternate methods to help with you depression, like medication, quitting smoking, alcohol etc., but without professional medical attention the equation to a better mental health remains uncompleted. to anyone suffering from depression and contemplating whether to go see a medical professional, this is the universe telling you to go seek medical treatment. when you realise that you may be suffering from depression, for whatever reason it may be, its your responsibility to take steps and get out of it. take action, get out of it and tomorrow you wi will be advising some other guy to do the right thing. empower yourself so you can empower others. to go through depression is a really painful experience. and one should never suffer silently, especially when there is a way out. go seek medical attention today. empower yourself so you can empower others. lets fight depression together.
label: not depression

text: ig follow recommendation the.holistic.psychologist i have found her posts to be extremely applicable to many of the problems i am now working through that feed into my depression. maybe some of you wi will find it helpful, too? they are quick posts that take complex ideas and put them into si ample, easy to understand terms, and someti ames she wi will expand on them with a long caption. here is one such caption how to do the work when we are triggered, we are experiencing a wound from the past in the present moment. let us say we are in line at a grocery store. we re browsing magazines when someone walks right past us getting in front of us, not noticing we are there. the feelings come from the body during this trigger. the thought stream from the ego comes into play they are so rude typical ignorant person cutting in front of me. our ego preservers the core belief about the false conditioned self i am not seen. i am not considered. then we hook into the emotions of this story, and we re unconsciously caught in this loop for hours. someti ames days. if we re really triggered, we wi will repeat this story to other people to re live our emotional addiction to this belief. our work is to question. our work is to observe these stories. to breathe, then consciously choose a new response in alignment with our true self. let us go with a trigger from someone closer, our mother. she makes a snide comment about something we are wearing. we re triggered. the ego starts talking she always does this. she is so critical and wonders why i do not want to spend ti ame here or she is right i knew these pants are not flattering, i need to loose weight. our ego preserves the core belief about the false conditioned self i am not worthy as i am. we have gone into a spiral of all of the past ti ames our mother commented on our body appearance. if we remain unconscious, we ll engage in a predictable dynamic with her. another way to keep our emotional addictions active. another way the ego wins. if we remain conscious and do the work, we wi will just observe. we wi will breathe. and pause. creating space to see that her comments come from her own wound likely the same patterning said to her by her own mother then we can choose a new response. we can engage differently, getting a small gli ampse of our power beyond ego. triggers are teachers. allow them to be. you ll allow yourself transformation selfhealers

text: abstract from an article which i read. thought it might be useful which brings me back to my work as a therapist. while the breadth of exercises and techniques employed in act is beyond the scope of this article, there is one exercise i would like to share that has helped some of my clients see the inextricable link between valued living and painful experiences. in this activity of which there are different variations , the therapist first asks the client to write on an index card some of the internal experiences they are struggling with most difficult thoughts and judgments, emotions, memories. i ask them, what do you notice when you read that index card? i feel awful, i do not want this. what do you want to do with the card? i want to throw it in the trash. then the client flips the card over, and i ask them to write out some of the things that are most i amportant, most meaningful to them being a parent, caring and supporting others, learning, growing, etc. what do you notice when you read this side? warmth, it feels right, this is who i want to be. where is the pain, where is the other stuff? sti will here, on the other side of the card. what happens if you push that pain away, escape or avoid it? i push the meaningful stuff away too. in your heart of hearts, what does your experience tell you right now? if i am going to do the things that are i amportant to me, be the person that i want to be, i also have to make room for the painful stuff.
label: not depression

text: subvocalization, visualization and memory. i was wondering if anyone else experiences trouble with memory and thinking. hopefully, this post does not break any of the rules. whenever i try to explain this to people, they do not understand and look at me sideways. ever since my depression reached a stage where it convinced my brain as suicide as a viable option, it is like the only thought that is ever produced. it is the final thought that has been created. for the past four years, i have had issues visualizing, which is a tremendous way, i think unless it is i amagining a suicide. this make is it difficult to do schoolwork such as math as i can not trace the steps in my head. i can not subvocalize either, which is essentially thinking or talking to yourself in your head. below is a theory about why this is. i had spoken to my psychology professor at college after learning about rumination in her class. i told her that i had a theory that the reason memory and thinking issues may have transpired from the depression was because of rumination. rumination is when you focus on negative events and go over and over it in your head. so i thought my brain must have protected itself against this by shrinking my hippocampus, making it more difficult to recall these negative memories, but this also made it more difficult to recall all other memories as well. i had almost eidetic memory before this i willness got me, and it frustrates me to hell that i am unable to think the way i used to. she said that this was incorrect, though, which put me down a little bit because i thought i was coming closer to the root cause of my trigger for this i willness.

text: to those who feel dejected or suicidal but have not told anyone i grew up with my emotions being centered around sadness. any joy, excitement, or thri will i experienced was always quickly reverted back to a state of melancholy and dejection. i was never clinically labeled as depressed, because i never told anyone how i felt i was never examined. one reason why despair was so prevalent within me was due to not having conversations about my feelings, which only amplified my negative thoughts. i sti will believe that i had good reasons to avoid talking about my thoughts with others during my upbringing. . my parents argued and were terrible and negotiating. . my parents hit me and scorned me which made me afraid of them. . my parents rarely asked me how i felt, which reveals further lack of consideration for my well being. . my sister and i mi amicked our parents we mostly argued. . some people at school were bullies. emotional expression was a target for them to attack i was not wi willing to take the risk. . my extended family was keen on threatening and hitting children, which made them untrustworthy from my perspective. my depression was initiated and perpetrated by the complete thisregard that other people had towards me. since i could not get angry without fear of attack, and i could not leave my situation i was sifted into a complacency role as a dependent and anxious child in a merciless and unsympathetic environment. if your experience is in any way si amilar to mine then i want to remind you of what you already know your suffering is not your fault. your suffering is mostly due to the environment and circumstances that you are subjected to by the design of your parents. someti ames we have to lie to others in order to protect ourselves from further damage that our peers and guardians wi will cause us. someti ames we have to lie to others, and that includes saying that we hate ourselves. i am here to argue, that you do not hate yourself. you hate everyone around you that allowed for and did not protect you from the predators that lurked within your tribe or community. for that, i am sorry.

text: i think i had a depression caused stroke. i always read about depression affecting your health negatively, but last week i had an episode in which i felt faint, face went numb, etc. i have a ongoing concussion so i thought something was happening along those lines. nope. my wife took me to the er and they concluded that i had a tia, or a mini stroke. they ran every kind of test on me and could not find a blood clot, so they assumed it thissolved on its own. i went to my regular physician for a follow up. he thought it was odd that i had a stroke. i am not exactly old or a smoker or extremely overweight or any other of the other risk factors. then he kind of said something in passing about how stress and depression can also cause these kind of events. i was shocked, but when he said it i knew that is what happened. i have been so super down for the past half year or so due to not working, money issues, kid issues, etc. and no one is really listening to me at how bad off i am. so i just wanted to get that out there. i thought it was kind of interesting. my wife and family tend to play down my depression, so they do not agree with me shocker! so i guess i wanted to share with those that might understand.
